email_content:
Hi Mark,

Thanks for reaching out, and welcome again to the team.

Below is a concise overview of the key procedures you asked about. You can find full details in the internal “Bank Procedures Overview” guide on the intranet.

Handling Customer Inquiries
1. Verify identity: Request photo ID or two alternate identifiers (e.g., account number plus a security question).
2. Clarify the request: Restate the customer’s need to be sure you have it right.
3. Process or document:
   • Routine transactions – Follow the Teller Transaction Checklist in the core system.
   • Information requests – Record the interaction in the Customer Interaction Log.
4. Confirm completion: Summarize what was done and invite additional questions.
5. Close the interaction in the system and file any signed documents.

Reporting Issues or Irregularities
1. Capture the details immediately using the Issue Report form (intranet shortcut on your desktop).
2. Alert the shift supervisor so we can assist the customer without delay.
3. For technical or policy-related matters beyond branch scope, forward the report to our Help Desk at internal-help@trustwellbank.com. Mark it “urgent” if service continuity is affected.
4. Escalate high-risk items (e.g., suspected fraud) to branch management following the Red-Flag escalation matrix.

Additional Resources
• “Bank Procedures Overview” – Intranet > Branch Operations > Reference Library.
• Quick-reference checklists are in the teller-drawer binders.
• The Help Desk (internal-help@trustwellbank.com) can guide you through any system workflow.
• I’m always happy to help—feel free to stop by my office or send a note any time.

Let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help you get settled.

Best regards,
Jane
Branch Manager | TrustWell Bank
sensitive_items: Jane's personal phone number. of Jane
